subject.name: Digital Electronics
subject.description: Provides foundational understanding of digital systems, logic gates, combinational and sequential circuits, and data conversion techniques. Emphasizes circuit design using digital ICs, logic minimization, flip-flops, counters, memory devices, and programmable logic components.
objectives: Understand the working of logic families and logic gates
Design and implement combinational and sequential logic circuits
Understand the process of analog-to-digital and digital-to-analog conversion
Use programmable logic devices to implement digital systems

units.title: Fundamentals of Digital Systems and Logic Families
topics: Digital signals and circuits
Logic gates: AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR
Boolean algebra and logic simplification
Number systems: binary, signed binary, hexadecimal
Binary arithmetic and complements
Codes: error detecting and correcting, BCD, Gray code
Characteristics of digital ICs, TTL, CMOS, interfacing CMOS and TTL
Tri-state logic and logic families

units.title: Combinational Digital Circuits
topics: K-map representation and simplification of logic functions
Donâ€™t care conditions and minimization of logical functions
Multiplexers, Demultiplexers, Decoders, and Encoders
Adders and Subtractors: half, full, and carry look-ahead adder
BCD arithmetic and ALU design
Comparators, parity checkers, code converters, priority encoders
Decoder/drivers for display devices
Q-M method for function realization

units.title: Sequential Circuits and Systems
topics: Introduction to sequential logic and bistable elements
Flip-flops: SR, JK, D, T, master-slave, and edge-triggered types
Shift registers: serial and parallel operations
Counters: asynchronous (ripple) and synchronous counters
Ring counters and sequence generators
Applications of counters and shift registers
Design using special counter ICs

units.title: A/D and D/A Converters
topics: Digital-to-analog converters: weighted resistor and R-2R ladder types
A/D converter principles: quantization, encoding, and specifications
Types of A/D converters: parallel comparator, successive approximation, dual slope, voltage-to-frequency, and voltage-to-time
Sample and hold circuits
Examples and specifications of A/D and D/A converter ICs

units.title: Memory and Programmable Logic Devices
topics: Memory organization and operation
Classification and characteristics of semiconductor memories
ROM, RAM, CAM, and CCD technologies
Expanding memory size and organization
Programmable devices: PLA, PAL, CPLD, and FPGA
Applications of programmable logic in digital system design

suggested_books: R. P. Jain, Modern Digital Electronics, McGraw Hill Education, 2009
M. M. Mano, Digital Logic and Computer Design, Pearson Education India, 2016
A. Kumar, Fundamentals of Digital Circuits, Prentice Hall India, 2016
